text: smushed corner, splitting seams, components excellent.

a tactical tile laying game with area control where players take turns placing 1 tile onto the board (maybe more with special tiles). if the token spaces ever surround by user played tiles, for each icon (3 types), the player with the highest sum of like icon on surround tiles gains icon, where samurais and ships are wild. once 4 pieces are out of the game or all of 1 type is off the game board, game ends. winner is determined by the player with the most majorities of the 3 types, tie breaker is the most non majority pieces, followed by sum of most pieces.

samurai is a good game, but it's not a fun game. with both babylonia and caesar out now, i see no reason to go back to samurai - although i might just for completion's sake at some point. i have only played at 2p and would like to try it at 3p. at 2p, i would rather play pretty much any no luck abstract over this as the randomness feels arbitrary and swingy. overrated (at least at 2).
